casebody.data:
MONTGOMERY COUNTY, MARYLAND v. GEORGE MEANY et al. [No. 44,

September Term, 1977.]

Decided October 10, 1977.

The cause was argued before Murphy, C. J., and Smith, Digges, Levine, Eldridge and Orth, JJ.

H. Christopher Malone, Assistant County Attorney, with whom were Richard S. McKemon, County Attorney, and Robert G. Tobin, Jr., Deputy County Attorney, on the brief, for appellant. J. Willard Nalls, Jr., with whom were Nalls & Nalls and Michael T. Nalls on the brief, for appellees. Per Curiam:

For reasons stated in the opinion of the Court of Special Appeals in Montgomery County v. Meany, 34 Md. App. 647, 368 A. 2d 1107 (1977), judgment is affirmed.

Judgment affirmed.

Costs to be paid by Montgomery County, Maryland.
